   19: %%% Purpose : Compiles various modules with tough code
   20: 
   21: -module(compilation_SUITE).
   22: -export([all/0,suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1,end_per_suite/1,
   23: 	 init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2,
   24: 	 beam_compiler_4/1,
   25: 	 beam_compiler_6/1,
   26: 	 beam_compiler_7/1,
   27: 	 beam_compiler_8/1,
   28: 	 beam_compiler_9/1,
   29: 	 beam_compiler_10/1,
   30: 	 beam_compiler_11/1,
   31: 	 compiler_1/1,
   32: 	 const_list_256/1,
   33: 	 convopts/1,
   34: 	 live_var/1,
   35: 	 on_load/1,
   36: 	 on_load_inline/1,
   37: 	 opt_crash/1,
   38: 	 otp_2330/1,
   39: 	 otp_2380/1,
   40: 	 otp_4790/1,
   41: 	 otp_5151/1,
   42: 	 otp_5235/1,
   43: 	 otp_5404/1,
   44: 	 otp_5436/1,
   45: 	 otp_5481/1,
   46: 	 otp_5553/1,
   47: 	 otp_5632/1,
   48: 	 otp_5714/1,
   49: 	 otp_5872/1,
   50: 	 otp_6121/1,
   51: 	 otp_7202/1,
   52: 	 otp_8949_a/1,
   53: 	 redundant_case/1,
   54: 	 self_compile/1,
   55: 	 self_compile_old_inliner/1,
   56: 	 split_cases/1,
   57: 	 string_table/1,
   58: 	 vsn_1/1,
   59: 	 vsn_2/1,
   60:          vsn_3/1,
   61:          infinite_loop/0,infinite_loop/1,
   62:          use_nifs/1]).
   63: 
   64: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   65: 
   66: suite() ->
   67:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   68:      {timetrap,{minutes,10}}].
   69: 
   70: all() -> 
   71:     [self_compile_old_inliner,self_compile,
   72:      {group,p}].
   73: 
   74: groups() -> 
   75:     [{vsn,[parallel],[vsn_1,vsn_2,vsn_3]},
   76:      {p,test_lib:parallel(),
   77:       [compiler_1,
   78:        beam_compiler_4,beam_compiler_6,beam_compiler_7,
   79:        beam_compiler_8,beam_compiler_9,beam_compiler_10,
   80:        beam_compiler_11,
   81:        otp_2330,
   82:        {group,vsn},otp_2380,otp_4790,
   83:        const_list_256,live_var,convopts,
   84:        redundant_case,
   85:        otp_5151,otp_5235,
   86:        opt_crash,otp_5404,otp_5436,otp_5481,
   87:        otp_5553,otp_5632,otp_5714,otp_5872,otp_6121,
   88:        otp_7202,on_load,on_load_inline,
   89:        string_table,otp_8949_a,split_cases,
   90:        infinite_loop,
   91:        use_nifs]}].
   92: 
   93: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   94:     test_lib:recompile(?MODULE),
   95:     Config.
   96: 
   97: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   98:     ok.
   99: 
  100: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  101:     Config.
  102: 
  103: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  104:     Config.
  105: 
  106: -define(comp(N),
  107: 	N(Config) when is_list(Config) -> try_it(N, Config)).
  108: 
  109: ?comp(compiler_1).
  110: 
  111: ?comp(beam_compiler_4).
  112: ?comp(beam_compiler_6).
  113: ?comp(beam_compiler_8).
  114: ?comp(beam_compiler_9).
  115: ?comp(beam_compiler_10).
  116: ?comp(beam_compiler_11).
  117: 
  118: ?comp(otp_2330).
  119: ?comp(otp_2380).
  120: ?comp(otp_4790).
  121: ?comp(otp_5235).
  122: 
  123: ?comp(const_list_256).
  124: 
  125: ?comp(otp_5151).
  126: 
  127: ?comp(live_var).
  128: ?comp(opt_crash).
  129: 
  130: ?comp(otp_5404).
  131: ?comp(otp_5436).
  132: ?comp(otp_5481).
  133: ?comp(otp_5553).
  134: ?comp(otp_5632).
  135: ?comp(otp_5714).
  136: ?comp(otp_5872).
  137: ?comp(otp_6121).
  138: ?comp(convopts).
  139: ?comp(otp_7202).

  141: ?comp(on_load_inline).
  142: 
  143: ?comp(use_nifs).
  144: 
  145: infinite_loop() -> [{timetrap,{minutes,1}}].
  146: ?comp(infinite_loop).
  147: 
  148: %% Code snippet submitted from Ulf Wiger which fails in R3 Beam.
  149: beam_compiler_7(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  150:     done = empty(2, false).
  151: 
  152: empty(N, Toggle) when N > 0 ->
  153:     %% R3 Beam copies the second argument to the first before call.
  154:     empty(N-1, not(Toggle));
  155: empty(_, _) ->
  156:     done.
  157: 
  158: redundant_case(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  159:     d = redundant_case_1(1),
  160:     d = redundant_case_1(2),
  161:     d = redundant_case_1(3),
  162:     d = redundant_case_1(4),
  163:     d = redundant_case_1(5),
  164:     d = redundant_case_1({glurf,glarf}),
  165:     ok.
  166: 
  167: %% This function always returns 'd'. Check that the compiler otptimizes
  168: %% it properly.
  169: redundant_case_1(1) -> d;
  170: redundant_case_1(2) -> d;
  171: redundant_case_1(3) -> d;
  172: redundant_case_1(4) -> d;
  173: redundant_case_1(_) -> d.
  174: 
  175: try_it(Module, Conf) ->
  176:     Timetrap = {minutes,10},
  177:     OtherOpts = [],			%Can be changed to [time] if needed
  178:     Src = filename:join(proplists:get_value(data_dir, Conf),
  179: 			atom_to_list(Module)),
  180:     Out = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Conf),
  181:     io:format("Compiling: ~s\n", [Src]),
  182:     CompRc0 = compile:file(Src, [clint0,clint,ssalint,{outdir,Out},report,
  183: 				 bin_opt_info,recv_opt_info|OtherOpts]),
  184:     io:format("Result: ~p\n",[CompRc0]),
  185:     {ok,Mod} = CompRc0,
  186: 
  187:     load_and_call(Out, Module),
  188: 
  189:     ct:timetrap(Timetrap),
  190:     io:format("Compiling (without optimization): ~s\n", [Src]),
  191:     CompRc1 = compile:file(Src,
  192: 			   [no_copt,no_postopt,
  193: 			    {outdir,Out},report|OtherOpts]),
  194: 
  195:     io:format("Result: ~p\n",[CompRc1]),
  196:     {ok,Mod} = CompRc1,
  197:     load_and_call(Out, Module),
  198: 
  199:     ct:timetrap(Timetrap),
  200:     io:format("Compiling (with old inliner): ~s\n", [Src]),
  201:     CompRc2 = compile:file(Src, [clint,ssalint,
  202: 				 {outdir,Out},report,bin_opt_info,
  203: 				 recv_opt_info,{inline,1000}|OtherOpts]),
  204:     io:format("Result: ~p\n",[CompRc2]),
  205:     {ok,Mod} = CompRc2,
  206:     load_and_call(Out, Module),
  207: 
  208:     ct:timetrap(Timetrap),
  209:     io:format("Compiling (from assembly): ~s\n", [Src]),
  210:     {ok,_} = compile:file(Src, [to_asm,{outdir,Out},report|OtherOpts]),
  211:     Asm = filename:join(Out, lists:concat([Module, ".S"])),
  212:     CompRc3 = compile:file(Asm, [from_asm,{outdir,Out},report|OtherOpts]),
  213:     io:format("Result: ~p\n",[CompRc3]),
  214:     {ok,_} = CompRc3,
  215:     load_and_call(Out, Module),
  216: 
  217:     ok.
  218: 
  219: load_and_call(Out, Module) ->
  220:     io:format("Loading...\n",[]),
  221:     {module,Module} = code:load_abs(filename:join(Out, Module)),
  222: 
  223:     io:format("Calling...\n",[]),
  224:     %% Call M:M, and expect ok back, that's our interface
  225:     CallRc = Module:Module(),
  226:     io:format("Got value: ~p\n",[CallRc]),
  227: 
  228:     ok = CallRc,
  229: 
  230:     %% Smoke-test of beam disassembler.
  231:     test_lib:smoke_disasm(Module),
  232: 
  233:     _ = code:delete(Module),
  234:     _ = code:purge(Module),
  235: 
  236:     %% Restore state of trap_exit just in case. (Since the compiler
  237:     %% uses a temporary process, we will get {'EXIT',Pid,normal} messages
  238:     %% if trap_exit is true.)
  239: 
  240:     process_flag(trap_exit, false),
  241:     ok.
  242: 
  243: 
  244: %% Test generation of 'vsn' attribute.
  245: vsn_1(Conf) when is_list(Conf) ->
  246:     M = vsn_1,
  247: 
  248:     compile_load(M, proplists:get_value(data_dir, Conf), Conf),
  249:     Vsn1 = get_vsn(M),
  250:     timer:sleep(1000),
  251: 
  252:     compile_load(M, proplists:get_value(data_dir, Conf), Conf),
  253:     Vsn2 = get_vsn(M),
  254: 
  255:     compile_load(M, filename:join(proplists:get_value(data_dir, Conf),
  256: 				  "other"),
  257: 		 Conf),
  258:     Vsn3 = get_vsn(M),
  259:     if
  260: 	Vsn1 == Vsn2, Vsn2 == Vsn3 ->
  261: 	    ok;
  262: 	true ->
  263: 	    ct:fail({vsn, Vsn1, Vsn2, Vsn3})
  264:     end,
  265:     ok.
  266: 
  267: %% Test overriding of generation of 'vsn' attribute.
  268: vsn_2(Conf) when is_list(Conf) ->
  269:     M = vsn_2,
  270: 
  271:     compile_load(M, proplists:get_value(data_dir, Conf), Conf),
  272:     Vsn = get_vsn(M),
  273:     case Vsn of
  274: 	[34] ->
  275: 	    ok;
  276: 	_ ->
  277: 	    ct:fail({vsn, Vsn})
  278:     end,
  279:     ok.
  280: 
  281: %% Test that different code yields different generated 'vsn'.
  282: vsn_3(Conf) when is_list(Conf) ->
  283:     M = vsn_3,
  284: 
  285:     compile_load(M, proplists:get_value(data_dir, Conf), Conf),
  286:     Vsn1 = get_vsn(M),
  287: 
  288:     compile_load(M, filename:join(proplists:get_value(data_dir, Conf),
  289: 				  "other"),
  290: 		 Conf),
  291:     Vsn2 = get_vsn(M),
  292:     if
  293: 	Vsn1 /= Vsn2 ->
  294: 	    ok;
  295: 	true ->
  296: 	    ct:fail({vsn, Vsn1, Vsn2})
  297:     end,
  298:     ok.
  299: 
  300: get_vsn(M) ->
  301:     {vsn,V} = lists:keyfind(vsn, 1, M:module_info(attributes)),
  302:     V.
  303: 
  304: compile_load(Module, Dir, Conf) ->
  305:     Src = filename:join(Dir, atom_to_list(Module)),
  306:     Out = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Conf),
  307:     CompRc = compile:file(Src, [{outdir,Out}]),
  308:     {ok, Module} = CompRc,
  309:     code:purge(Module),
  310:     {module, Module} =
  311: 	code:load_abs(filename:join(Out, atom_to_list(Module))),
  312:     ok.
  313: 
  314: self_compile(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  315:     ct:pal(?HI_IMPORTANCE, "Starting self_compile~n"),
  316:     self_compile_1(Config, "new", [inline]).
  317: 
  318: self_compile_old_inliner(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  319:     %% The old inliner is useful for testing that sys_core_fold does not
  320:     %% introduce name capture problems.
  321:     ct:pal(?HI_IMPORTANCE, "Starting self_compile_old_inliner~n"),
  322:     self_compile_1(Config, "old", [verbose,{inline,500}]).
  323: 
  324: self_compile_1(Config, Prefix, Opts) ->
  325:     ct:timetrap({minutes,40}),
  326: 
  327:     Priv = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
  328:     Version = compiler_version(),
  329: 
  330:     %% Compile the compiler. (In this node to get better coverage.)
  331:     CompA = make_compiler_dir(Priv, Prefix++"compiler_a"),
  332:     VsnA = Version ++ ".0",
  333:     ct:pal(?HI_IMPORTANCE, "self_compile_1: 0~n"),
  334:     compile_compiler(compiler_src(), CompA, VsnA, Opts),
  335:     ct:pal(?HI_IMPORTANCE, "self_compile_1: 1~n"),
  336:     %% Compile the compiler again using the newly compiled compiler.
  337:     %% (In another node because reloading the compiler would disturb cover.)
  338:     CompilerB = Prefix++"compiler_b",
  339:     CompB = make_compiler_dir(Priv, CompilerB),
  340:     VsnB = VsnA ++ ".0",
  341:     ct:pal(?HI_IMPORTANCE, "self_compile_1: 2~n"),
  342:     self_compile_node(CompA, CompB, VsnB, Opts),
  343:     ct:pal(?HI_IMPORTANCE, "self_compile_1: 3~n"),
  344:     %% Compare compiler directories. The compiler directories should
  345:     %% be equal (except for beam_asm that contains the compiler version).
  346:     compare_compilers(CompA, CompB),
  347: 
  348:     ok.
  349: 
  350: self_compile_node(CompilerDir, OutDir, Version, Opts) ->
  351:     ct:timetrap({minutes,15}),
  352:     Pa = "-pa " ++ filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)) ++
  353: 	" -pa " ++ CompilerDir,
  354:     Files = compiler_src(),
  355: 
  356:     %% We don't want the cover server started on the other node,
  357:     %% because it will load the same cover-compiled code as on this
  358:     %% node. Use a shielded node to prevent the cover server from
  359:     %% being started.
  360:     test_server:run_on_shielded_node(
  361:       fun() ->
  362: 	      compile_compiler(Files, OutDir, Version, Opts)
  363:       end, Pa),
  364: 
  365:     ok.
  366: 
  367: compile_compiler(Files, OutDir, Version, InlineOpts) ->
  368:     io:format("~ts", [code:which(compile)]),
  369:     io:format("Compiling ~s into ~ts", [Version,OutDir]),
  370:     Opts = [report,
  371: 	    clint0,clint,ssalint,
  372: 	    bin_opt_info,
  373:             recv_opt_info,
  374: 	    {outdir,OutDir},
  375: 	    {d,'COMPILER_VSN',"\""++Version++"\""},
  376: 	    nowarn_shadow_vars,
  377: 	    {i,filename:join(code:lib_dir(stdlib), "include")}|InlineOpts],
  378:     test_lib:p_run(fun(File) ->
  379: 			   case compile:file(File, Opts) of
  380: 			       {ok,_} ->
  381:                                    ok;
  382: 			       E ->
  383:                                    ct:pal(?HI_IMPORTANCE, "!! ~s: error: ~p~n",
  384:                                           [File, E]),
  385:                                    error
  386: 			   end
  387: 		   end, Files).
  388: 
  389: compiler_src() ->
  390:     filelib:wildcard(filename:join([code:lib_dir(compiler), "src", "*.erl"])).
  391: 
  392: make_compiler_dir(Priv, Dir0) ->
  393:     Dir = filename:join(Priv, Dir0),
  394:     ok = file:make_dir(Dir),
  395:     Dir.
  396: 
  397: compiler_version() ->
  398:     {version,Version} = lists:keyfind(version, 1,
  399: 				      compile:module_info(compile)),
  400:     Version.
  401: 
  402: compare_compilers(ADir, BDir) ->
  403:     {[],[],D} = beam_lib:cmp_dirs(ADir, BDir),
  404: 
  405:     %% beam_asm.beam contains compiler version and therefore it *must*
  406:     %% compare unequal.
  407:     ["beam_asm.beam"] = [filename:basename(A) || {A,_} <- D],
  408:     ok.
  409: 
  410: %% Check the generation of the string table.
  411: 
  412: string_table(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  413:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  414:     File = filename:join(DataDir, "string_table.erl"),
  415:     {ok,string_table,Beam,[]} = compile:file(File, [return, binary]),
  416:     {ok,{string_table,[StringTableChunk]}} = beam_lib:chunks(Beam, ["StrT"]),
  417:     {"StrT", <<"abcdefghiABCDEFGHI">>} = StringTableChunk,
  418:     ok.
  419: 
  420: otp_8949_a(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  421:     value = do_otp_8949_a(),
  422:     ok.
  423: 
  424: -record(cs, {exs,keys = [],flags = 1}).
  425: -record(exs, {children = []}).
  426: 
  427: do_otp_8949_a() ->
  428:     case id([#cs{}]) of
  429:         [#cs{}=Cs] ->
  430:             SomeVar = id(value),
  431: 	    if
  432: 		Cs#cs.flags band 1 =/= 0 ->
  433: 		    id(SomeVar);
  434: 		(((Cs#cs.exs)#exs.children /= [])
  435:                  and
  436: 		   (Cs#cs.flags band (1 bsl 0 bor (1 bsl 22)) == 0));
  437: 		Cs#cs.flags band (1 bsl 22) =/= 0 ->
  438: 		    ok
  439: 	    end
  440:     end.
  441:     
  442: split_cases(_) ->
  443:     dummy1 = do_split_cases(x),
  444:     {'EXIT',{{badmatch,b},_}} = (catch do_split_cases(y)),
  445:     ok.
  446: 
  447: do_split_cases(A) ->
  448:     case A of
  449:         x ->
  450: 	    Z = dummy1;
  451:         _ ->
  452: 	    Z = dummy2,
  453: 	    a=b
  454:     end,
  455:     Z.
  456: 
  457: id(I) -> I.
